item.title: Generator
item.description: In Python, a generator is a special type of function that can be used to create iterable sequences of values on-the-fly. Unlike regular functions, which compute and return a value immediately, generators can generate a sequence of values over time, using the yield keyword. Example: The following fib function is a generator function that generates a sequence of Fibonacci numbers up to a given limit index n. def fib(n): a = [0, 1] i = 0 while i <= n: yield a[i%2] a[i%2] = a[0] + a[1] i += 1 The yield keyword is used to return each generated Fibonacci number as it is generated, which makes the function a generator.
